review_blob: Bottle 266 of 801, Well this beer probably wouldnt have been that good, but I am pretty sure it isnt supposed to be a sour stout but it is. So this beer was actually a really good sour beer that reminded me of Madrugada Obscura. Closer to a porter in its base flavor and smell with strong vinegar smell and taste over top of that.

Well it looks like a normal imperial stout and smells like a chocolaty one, but taste like it has liquid bbq/campfire flavor in it. I personally love the taste, but still isnt anywhere close to being worth the price. Also I am drinking this probably around 60F or maybe even a little warmer.
beer_name: Mikkeller Black Hole Barrel Aged Edition Peat Whiskey

review_blob: Bottled 2-12-08 and well flat, no head, no aroma and no flavor. Kinda tastes like a brown ale that was watered down. Wish I would have read the reviews before I purchased this.
2011 release...Just delicious, Nice vanilla caramel chocolate taste with a slight hint of bourbon but enough you know its there. Very smooth
beer_name: Dark Horse Bourbon Barrel Plead the 5th Imperial Stout

review_blob: Cloudy brown color with a froth long lasting almost tan head...I really like this one, the flavors caught me by surprise and at this point in my beer journey doesnt quite taste like any ipa or iipa ive had.

12oz bottle...Dark brown with tan head..Nice strong aroma of holiday spices with the same coming through in the taste...I normally dont like christmas or pumpkin beers with weird spices but I really enjoy this one
I dont care, until I have somthing better, this and the rest of the Dark Horse stouts are some of the best beers I have had. They are not hyped like crazy and cost $7 a 4-pack. YUM!

Draught...Medium brown in color..smells sweet and caramelized with rum...Tastes very good compared to the regular version, For me the way too much hazelnut almost extract flavor is gone and replaced with a lot more complexity...I get caramel, brown sugar, rum, with a slight sour finish

Draught in snifter....Clear yellow pour, seriously looks like budweiser or something similar...Aroma is sweet almost candy like...Taste is sweet with some caramel and fruit but mostly alcohol and more alcohol and when I got past the alcohol really just way too sweet.

12oz bottle blah blah... I have a love hate with this beer, I had a nice dark stout the other night before this and it tasted horrible, but did the same tonight and it tastes the way I remember from last year. This beer is not that complex, the flavor is dominated by strong caramel and burnt sugar. Still pretty solid and ill have some more this year and probably next.

Growler from the brewery...Nice well rounded stout. I get a little of a few things...some chocolate, some coffee and a little roasted flavor. None too strong but nice and balanced and a little sweet and creamy almost like a milk/sweet stout.
Had at the brewpub on tab and somehow smelled like a skunked beer. Tasted ok but nothing special and hard to concentrate on taste when aroma is like a skunk.

Pours black with a tan head. Had very good coffee and stout taste but with a light easy drinking body and mouthfeel. Tastes very good for being in a mix pack, now I just want a six or twelve of it on its own.

Wow! I had no idea what to expect from this beer but I love it. 12oz bottle into snifter...Very strong hop aroma especially right after pouring which faded after a few minutes. Taste is very floral without much bitter.

Not gonna get technical on this one. It is strong on hops and alcohol. If they cut the alcohol down to 10 or 12 something that a normal yeast could do I think this would be a great beer at $12 for a 4-pack, but to me for the price this beer is just meh. Had a Hoptimum last year and I liked a lot more than this.

I think this tastes like a very good porter. It poured almost black with a tan head. It has a slight smell of bourbon with some chocolate roastyness. If this came in a six pack for $9 I would drink it all the time, but it was $10 for a 4 pack and not worth it at that price. Also it has no flavor added from the bourbon barrel. Other than all that complaining I really did like it, just not the price.
beer_name: Atwater Shamans Porter - Bourbon Barrel Aged

review_blob: 22oz into snifter...pours almost black with a tan head...Tastes not so good to me, I was really excited about this one but it is not that good. Tastes very bitter from the hops and from something else I get more bitter. When it warmed up a little all I could taste was alcohol. Just not impressed, was hoping for a stronger sublimely self righteous or something, but this isnt it.
beer_name: Stone 15th Anniversary Escondidian Imperial Black IPA

review_blob: I wanna say the vodka of beer or at least what vodka is supposed to be...Flavorless and odorless alcohol

12 oz bottle into snifter...Pours brown with a small off white head. The smell is very much coffee and so is the taste. Coffee is pretty much all I smell and taste but somehow isnt overwhelming. Im not a big coffee person but this is still pretty good to me and I think the first doppelbock I have had that I enjoy.

On tap at Dark Horse takeover at Crunchys...A nice red color, smell was hard for me at first because it smells very much like vinegar. The taste is just wow I didnt know a beer could be this sour. If anyone remembers them, to me it was like Warhead candy in your mouth. Great raspberry flavor though with a slightly acidic burn going down.

Had on Tap at Dark Horse takeover night at Crunchys. I wanted to like this but maybe I got the end of the keg or something cause it was very cloudy and very chunky. After getting past the chunks the taste was bad. I would say like a chalky tasting pale ale, no fig to be found for me.
22oz bottle poured into snifter...pours a red-orange color with a big lasting white head. First sip...Mouthgasm! Second sip...Mouthgasm.

22oz ... pours black with a tan head. Smells boozy with some chocolate and tastes the same. I think Im still not ready for these types of strong ales cause all I notice is booze and not too much else. After several sips I dont notice anymore but still cant really pick out flavors.

2011 Vintage 22oz into snifter...poors black with a very small tan head and little aroma also. Only scent I can pick up is a slight boozy one. First taste is slightly boozy as well but only stays with the first sip or two. After that it is very smooth...slight dark chocolate and slight roast with a pretty fizzy mouthfeel.

12oz bottle...poors a very nice golden color with a fair amount of carbonation. Didnt have hardly any head but could be that I poured into a goblet. Had a slightly spicy bite on the first sip, but after a few it is very smooth.
UPDATED: NOV 28, 2011
22oz bottle...Smells like spicy bacon, no smell of beer at all. It also taste like spicy bacon. Almost no resemblance to beer but I still find it pretty good.

2009 Bottle...black with small brown head. Tastes of alcohol, alcohol and more alcohol before some chocolate comes through and maybe my bottle is bad but tastes very metallic then finishes with an alcohol taste.
22 oz bottle...poors dark brown almost black with a very thick light brown head. Smells and taste like dark chocolate with a slight roasted flavor also.

1pt .9oz bottle...pours a dark red/brown with very small off white head. Smells skunky I think do to the trip overseas and the green bottle, but luckily does not taste skunky. It tastes toasted with caramel and a slight bit of chocolate.

22oz bottle...poors slightly amber with a very small white head. Smells very strong of citrus and spruce. Wish it tasted more like it smelled. Tastes well the only way I can think of to describe it as not as fresh as it smells.
22oz bottle...Pours a cloudy brown with an off white head. A lot more hop flavor and overall stronger than I expected.

Had on tap at Old Chicago...this beer was really unexpected. It was almost like a lightly carbonated scotch or whiskey. That might not seem appealing, but it was excellent. Very enjoyable. Was way smoother than its parent dirty bastard.
12 oz Bottle. Hazy caramel color with a tan head. Toffee and caramel nose, toast, alcohol as it warms. Roasty malt flavor, brown sugar, tiny bit of smoke and chocolate.  Easy drinking for ABV.
750ml bottle... poors very dark brown with a tan head. Decently fizzy and very light tasting for having such a dark color.

22 oz bottle .... Hazy amber color, big white head that disappeared very quick. Doesnt smell that hoppy to me and I cant really identify the tastes. I may be ruined cause I just had hopslam yesterday, but this wasnt as impressive as I had anticipated.
Absolutely amazing. Smells and tastes like a delicious vanilla coffee. Black in color with a tan head.
beer_name: Southern Tier Blackwater Series: Creme Brulee Stout

review_blob: 22oz bottle...Pours very dark basically black with a brown head. Smells and tastes chocolaty. Also has some nice toasted notes.
If you love ginger I guess this is good for you. Smells and taste like a gingerbread cookie.

750ml bottle into a snifter...this is my first sour and I dont know how I feel about it. The color is a very nice red-brown. The taste got better with each sip, but was very overwhelming and sour on the first try.
24oz bottle...poors a deep amber color with an off white head. Has a nice slight citrus aroma. Taste fairly hoppy as well without overwhelming the barley.

22oz Flip top...Nice amber color with a white lumpy head. Has a slight wine smell, also has light sour/wine tastes in it. Picked it up mostly for the bottle, but for a lighter beer night it surprised me and tasted pretty good for what it is.
12 oz bottle... Very dark brown in color with a small light tan head. Nice and chocolaty, a little coffee and good toasted malt taste. Finishes so smooth, almost seems a little watery in the finish.

Well I taste no nut for the nut brown part of this. If it was just a brown ale its not too bad. I think it is over carbonated. Really just nothing special and I can even taste the alcohol a little over the flavor.
UPDATED: JAN 30, 2011

It is probably because this is my favorite style of beer and my favorite brewery, but this is my favorite beer I have ever had. It really is nothing fancy but works for me. To me its a a pretty flat beer with caramel and strong toasted flavors being the leaders. If you love this style definitely give this one a shot.
Seriously if Miller wants to compete with Bud Light they really need to fix this beer. I would rather have Busch Light over this, not to mention they spell lite wrong : )

Ok so I love beer and I love whiskey, yet this one does not work for me or most other beer lovers I know. Crazy beers are great when they actually taste good. This might honestly be better if it was in those weird little 7oz Corona bottles. This just has an insane amount of flavors that are way too overwhelming.
